help.how_it_works_text: Every several seconds, the application pretends to watch a particular stream by fetching stream metadata - this is enough to advance the drops. Note that this completely bypasses the need to download any actual stream of video and sound. To keep the status (ONLINE or OFFLINE) of the channels up-to-date, there's a websocket connection established that receives events about streams going up or down, or updates regarding the current number of viewers.
help.getting_started_text:
1. Login to the application.
2. Ensure your Twitch account is linked to all campaigns you're interested in mining.
3. If you're interested in mining everything possible, change the Priority Mode to anything other than "Priority list only" and press on "Reload".
4. If you want to mine specific games first, use the "Priority" list to set up an ordered list of games of your choice. Games from the top of the list will be attempted to be mined first, before the ones lower down the list.
5. Keep the "Priority mode" selected as "Priority list only", to avoid mining games that are not on the priority list. Or not - it's up to you.
6. Use the "Exclude" list to tell the application which games should never be mined.
7. Changing the contents of either of the lists, or changing the "Priority mode", requires you to press on "Reload" for the changes to take an effect.
help.about_text: This application automatically mines timed Twitch drops without downloading stream data.
how_to_use_items: Login using your Twitch account (OAuth device code flow)
The miner will automatically discover campaigns and start mining
Configure priority games in Settings to focus on what you want
Monitor progress in the Main and Inventory tabs
important_notes_items: Do not watch streams on the same account while mining
Requires linked game accounts for drops
